segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, his face a mix of excitement and focus as he reaches for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He seems completely unaware of the danger below him, and I can feel my heart race for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and I can’t help but think how quickly things can go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I glance over at the woman, still polishing that plate, so engrossed in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in her own world, disconnected from the thrilled chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s something simultaneously charming and alarming about the whole scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside the boy raises her hand, inviting him to share the spoils, completely unaware of the imminent risk.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how children thrive on this kind of spontaneity, even if it leads to trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I feel a pang of worry; if he does fall, it could end in tears.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kitchen is filled with laughter and innocence, yet the potential for disaster looms large.
segments.speaker: PAR
